intro: Hoya versteegii, commonly known as the "Coral Hoya," is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and waxy, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Hoya versteegii is a popular houseplant due to its low maintenance and ability to thrive in indirect light. It is also noted for its ability to produce aerial roots, which can be used for propagation.
